page.title: 17THE RECTORY
page.content: The first rector{a monk}lived above the{Holy Well}at Trezance Farm.The monastic house was closed about 1550 and some of the stones can be seen at Trezance Farm.The original rectory was built of stone in about 1840 on what is now the lawn of Cardinham House a holiday complex.It was{bombed in 1942 and demolished about 1950 when a new rectory was built. There has been a church here for 1600 years.In1480 the present church was built ,the nave and aisles made of granite .The aisle's roofs are original 15c. oak ones but the nave was reroofed in the 1880s.The roofs need{repairing urgently}but the walls and floor are sound.The{bats}damage woodwork and floors with their droppings.Because they are a protected species they cannot be moved.. _
